awd_titl_txt: Japan (JSPS) Postdoctoral Program:  Basic Mechanisms of     Semiconductor Processing Technologies
awd_abstract_narration: This award will provide supplementary support to enable Dr. Paul                Fons of the University of Illinois to conduct collaborative                     research for 12 months with Dr. Teruaki Motooka of the University               of Tsukuba, Japan.  They will investigate the basic mechanisms of               solid-phase epitaxy of amorphous silicon on crystalline silicon                 and the physics of silica/silicon interfaces.                                                                                                                   Semiconductor processing technologies are becoming increasing                   dependent on a detailed understanding of non-equilibrium solid-                 phase interfaces and growth mechanisms.  This study will attempt                to characterize interfacial properties using Raman spectroscopy,                time-resolved ellipsometry, and electrical measurements.                        Interfacial structure will be modeled using both Molecular-Orbital              and Molecular Dynamics calculations.  Dr. Motooka's extensive                   experience with the theoretical analysis of interface structure                 and proficiency in the interpretation of related experimental data              should complement and focus Dr. Fon's broad background in                       metallurgy, solid-state physics, solid-state devices, and computer              simulations.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
